channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: A break in play threw England off their line and length, and the Pakistani batsmen capitalised.
item.title: Silverwood frustrated by two-faced England as Pakistan get away

item.description: Florida’s rate is approaching a quarter of that seen in New York at its peak in mid-April.
item.title: Florida tops 500,000 virus cases as testing resumes after storm

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Officials at the port where a stockpile of ammonium nitrate exploded have been arrested amid rising fury in Lebanon over the disaster.
item.title: 'State of shock': Arrests made in Lebanon as recovery from blast begins

item.description: The new Instagram feature has been released in 50 countries, including Australia, and will let users record and edit 15-second videos with audio, and will let users add visual effects.
item.title: Facebook launches its new TikTok clone, Instagram Reels

item.description: Coronavirus updates from around the world: New York City sets up quarantine checkpoints, Chicago schools go online and infections rise in Spain and Scotland.
item.title: New York City sets up quarantine checkpoints for interstate visitors

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Australia’s clean energy investment agency is broadening its focus from renewables to hydrogen and the electricity grid to help the economy recovery from COVID.
item.title: Clean energy agency set for 'real evolution' in post-COVID economy

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Education ministers have been urged to ensure no child leaves primary school unable to read, but critics warn there is no silver bullet to fix the "literacy emergency".
item.title: Too many children leave primary school unable to read, campaigners warn

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: The plea for protection came as Max Gawn admitted a muscle tear had left him in doubt for the Adelaide game.
item.title: Gawn needs to be protected from unfair targeting, says Goodwin

item.description: It's official. Heritage counts for nothing in Parramatta.
item.title: Parramatta MP's attitude belongs in a museum

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: A deadly explosion in Lebanon has reignited concerns about the stockpiling of ammonium nitrate near residential areas in Australia.
item.title: Lebanon blast alarms NSW residents living near ammonium nitrate stockpiles

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Cricket Australia is considering tearing up the international schedule as fears rise over the worsening coronavirus situation in Victoria.
item.title: Summer schedule chaos: Adelaide in frame for Boxing Day Test amid Victoria virus fears

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Many Queensland tourism operators are struggling to stay afloat as their state's borders close again.
item.title: Northern NSW havens poised to cash in after Queensland shuts border

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Former top public servant Martin Parkinson has warned Australia is not doing enough to cut greenhouse emissions or adapt to a changed environment.
item.title: Australia not doing enough to curb emissions, warns Parkinson

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: A new report finds that in the most severe scenario of recurring outbreaks and lockdowns, the number of children in out-of-home care could more than double to 27,500 in six years.
item.title: Pandemic impacts 'could push thousands more children into care'

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The veteran may be "embarrassed" to pass the 300-game milestone for the Sydney Roosters, but one decision showed what he means to the premiers.
item.title: The grand final move that proved Aubusson's worth to the Roosters

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, August 6

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The border lockdown plan came as three more people were accused of lying on their declaration forms and failing to tell officials they had travelled to a COVID-19 hotspot.
item.title: Border communities brace for latest Queensland lockdown

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Indigenous Australians Minister Ken Wyatt said it was now recognised the only way to Close the Gap was for Indigenous Australians to drive improvements.
item.title: Indigenous-run services given $50m to take control of Closing the Gap

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, August 6

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: NSW is on high alert as health authorities guard against the threat of multiple COVID-19 clusters with an unknown source breaking through containment defences.
item.title: 'Fifty-fifty chance' NSW will see surge in cases as clusters grow

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The corporate watchdog is preparing for potential waves of small business insolvencies in 2021 and beyond.
item.title: Regulator braces for waves of COVID-19 insolvencies

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia will deny Qantas a monopoly in the lucrative corporate travel and ditch plans to move downmarket and become a "hybrid" carrier.
item.title: Virgin back in business to take fight to Qantas

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: COVID has taught us: we can't rely on immigration to fill our skills gap. There are many Australians who can step in.
item.title: How to fill the tradie skills gap: women

item.description: A retirement village resident, locked down by the risk of coronavirus, is grateful that his lifelong addiction to the moving image has not been interrupted.
item.title: One thing COVID can't lock down: my life in front of screens

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The CEOs of Virgin and NIB, and the chairmen of Wesfarmers and AMP have called for a clearer blueprint for COVID-19 amid concerns about Victoria's lockdown.
item.title: Top CEOs, directors call for clearer COVID-19 plan

item.description: International leaders of the Red Cross write to warn there are 13,000 nuclear weapons in the world - many on a "hair trigger" - and there is no capacity to deal with the aftermath of another nuclear disaster.
item.title: Seventy-five years after Hiroshima, nuclear catastrophe remains a threat - and no one could help

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: He made streetwear preppy and pioneered the celebrity fashion collaboration, but Tommy Hilfiger's latest project is rooted in his life as a parent.
item.title: Tommy Hilfiger: There will never be a point that we say 'OK, now we’re inclusive'

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: New research shows head-on crashes can cause serious injuries even at very low speeds.
item.title: Heartbroken mother calls on drivers to drop 'she'll be right' attitude

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: Shaky start to Games, accidental solo flight and rival film festival.
item.title: In the Herald: August 6, 1966

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: New analysis has revealed most VET graduates, particularly women and part-time workers, don't earn enough to repay student loans.
item.title: Less than half of vocational loans would be repaid, research shows

item.description: On August 6, 1986, a record 327mm of rain fell in Sydney within a 24 hour period - causing chaos, disruptions to city services, and five deaths.
item.title: From the Archives, 1986: Sydney drenched, wettest 24 hours on record

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: While the thrill of popping out between meetings for some well-deserved self-care may seem like a distant memory, great hair doesn't have to be.
item.title: Give yourself a salon-quality blow-dry

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: ABC chair Ita Buttrose is putting her own stamp on the national broadcaster.
item.title: Ita gives Twiggy star billing at Aunty's Boyer Lectures

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: As Victoria recorded its darkest day of the pandemic so far, a plan for elderly people to return to St Basil’s Homes for the Aged was revealed.
item.title: Elderly residents to return to site of deadliest COVID-19 outbreak

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Home builders in Melbourne will only be allowed five people on site at any one time under new stage four restrictions and workers will only be permitted to attend one site.
item.title: Builders fear stage four restrictions will halt home construction

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Adelaide are now winless after 10 rounds but the shame would have been greater for Melbourne had they lost to the winless Crows.
item.title: Demons get the devil off their back over winless Crows

item.description: The gradual and staged implementation of poorly executed restrictions has created more economic harm than would have been caused by a rapid and shorter total shutdown.
item.title: Shorter, sharper shutdown would have worked better

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: No one ever said formulating an appropriate government response to a deadly pandemic was easy. But did it really have to be this hard?
item.title: From brothels to knackeries, the intricacies of lockdown astound

item.dc:creator: Esther Han
item.description: Foreign Minister Marise Payne said the Australian government was "shocked and saddened" by the massive blast in Beirut.
item.title: Australia sends $2 million in aid to Lebanon after Beirut blast

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The AFP will have its cyber capabilities significantly bolstered so it can track down serious criminals using computer servers on the "dark web" within Australia.
item.title: Federal Police given new powers in $1.66 billion cyber security package

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The Kangaroos are sweating on the extent of a knee injury to key forward Ben Brown.
item.title: Kangaroos hope Brown knee injury not too serious

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Four men in their 20s are in custody following an investigation into robberies at pharmacies and restaurants across Sydney's south-west and north-west over the past year.
item.title: Four men charged over string of robberies across Sydney

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 6, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Jane Hume says the government has no plans to backflip on the legislated increase to the super guarantee, but it will be controversial to keep it.
item.title: Government resists pressure to abandon 'controversial' rise to super

item.description: And a museum to cage the elephant.
item.title: It takes a suburb to raise a proposal

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has stepped up efforts to keep COVID-19 cases from crossing the Victorian border.
item.title: Victoria's failure to stop coronavirus spread isolates NSW, could jeopardise food supply

item.description: The Duchess of Sussex is suing the publisher of the Mail on Sunday over five articles that published portions of a handwritten letter she wrote to her estranged father.
item.title: Meghan friends can stay anonymous in privacy case: court

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A leading women's charity has launched a guide to help women aged 55 and over avoid homelessness after a sudden change of circumstance.
item.title: How an educated, married Brisbane mother became homeless at 66
